0: The study targeted gay black and Hispanic men in Los Angeles, utilizing banner ads that offered access to HIV testing kits by mail or via pharmacy or vending machine in the parking lot of the L.A. LGBT Center. These groups were chosen as they are the most likely to become infected for HIV and least likely to seek out or receive testing for it, according to the study. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The research produced a whopping 69% of men who responded to survey questions who hadn't been tested for the infection within the last six months.
